comment: Attendance is not mandatory and powerpoints are posted online however tests are VERY tough. He's not a very interactive professor, there was hardly any discussion in class and so it was very hard to pay attention and learn. He presents the material very dryly. Tests questions are both very vague & very specific so it's hard to study for.  DONT TAKE
Very difficult tests. Study guides were 70 pages long.
Really nice guy. He seems to genuinely love his work and his students. The class itself was really easy; read the chapters and you'll pass. Also, he's big on curves.

chillest professor ever. doesn't grade tough. tests are mostly from the powerpoint info. didn't read from the book and i got an A in the class. interesting class. participate in discussion and you will for sure get an A.

He's a great professor and is really down to earth. He was very understanding and caring about the students, and was really reasonable. I wish more professors are  like him. I had him for human sexuality, the anthropology version, and i enjoyed the class and the discussion we had. You needed the book for the class, but his lecture and pp were good

He is a great teacher- very straight forward & down to earth. It takes a bit of time to get used to his humour and teaching style (he can come across as slightly awkward), but he's much more comfortable once you get acquainted with him. He's very smart, super nice, and I quite enjoyed him as a professor. He's also the tallest person I've ever met.
He's a pretty cool guy. I did not struggle in his class. Just take notes and listen to his lectures, its really not hard.

100% lecture based teaching style. Extremely boring and dull lectures. The lectures consisted of him reading directly from a PowerPoint for the entirety of the class. This class had the potential to be interesting and even controversial, but he managed to make it the most boring class I have ever taken. He's a nice person but a very dull professor.
